My first attempt at Thai in Barcelona - and I'll have to admit that it was pretty good.  The lunch menu was 13.25 - and while it was slightly pricier than the other local places nearby, I was thankful for the different flavors offered.  The soup I selected was flavored with Keffir lime and lemongrass, and was delightful.   The second plate was the version of what is usually labeled as Pad See Ew in Los Angeles - which is always my favorite go-to dish when I order Thai in LA.  It wasn't exactly what I was longing for, but I enjoyed it nonetheless.  It was also exquisitely spicy.  I have a high tolerance for spicy, and this was a spicy dish... I'd like to return and try a curry dish. The service was fine, as was the setting.  I'm glad we stumbled upon Thai Manohra - it's definitely a nice option when seeking something exotic, asian, and spicy.
